item.title: Day 6 of 6 hiking in Swedish Lapland. Just 14km left to walk, exhausted but happy. The views were...
item.description: Day 6 of 6 hiking in Swedish Lapland. Just 14km left to walk, exhausted but happy. The views were still varied and beautiful, but it was kind of sad to say goodbye to the mountains and almost overwhelming to see so many hikers. I really like it when you can walk for days without meeting a soul. This has definitely been one of the best adventures of my life so far and I can't wait to get back for another project. | 7 image(s) | Posted: Aug 02, 2023 01:32 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 6 of 6 hiking in Swedish Lapland. Just 14km left to walk, exhausted but happy. The views were still varied and beautiful, but it was kind of sad to say goodbye to the mountains and almost overwhelming to see so many hikers. I really like it when you can walk for days without meeting a soul. This has definitely been one of the best adventures of my life so far and I can't wait to get back for another project.

item.title: Day 5 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. We only walked on the famous Kungsleden (king's road) for ~8km on...
item.description: Day 5 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. We only walked on the famous Kungsleden (king's road) for ~8km on day 4, but the day 5 and 6 hikes were very similar to that type of more flat hiking on well trodden paths. The scenery is no less varied and beautiful though, but doesn't feel as remote and wild anymore, with a lot more green. On this day we followed a rainbow, which seemed to push the expected rain away from us. More magic. | 10 image(s) | Posted: Aug 01, 2023 12:12 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 5 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. We only walked on the famous Kungsleden (king's road) for ~8km on day 4, but the day 5 and 6 hikes were very similar to that type of more flat hiking on well trodden paths. The scenery is no less varied and beautiful though, but doesn't feel as remote and wild anymore, with a lot more green. On this day we followed a rainbow, which seemed to push the expected rain away from us. More magic.

item.title: Day 4 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. This should have been a rest day and we learned our lesson. The 10...
item.description: Day 4 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. This should have been a rest day and we learned our lesson. The 10 hours of hard walking on day 3 was tough on the body, but instead of taking a day off, we attempted to walk to the highest peak of Sweden, the Kebnekaise. It would have been a 12-14 hour hike, but after 4 hours of tough ascent in difficult terrain, the clouds came, it started raining. We had to admit it was too risky and we were not fit enough to go on. We turned back to the tent, packed up and arrived at Singhi hut soaked and exhausted. It was the hardest day in terms of hours, steps and altitude difference even though we didn't reach the peak. Of course the hard work was rewarded with breathtaking views on this day too. | 9 image(s) | Posted: Jul 31, 2023 05:44 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 4 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. This should have been a rest day and we learned our lesson. The 10 hours of hard walking on day 3 was tough on the body, but instead of taking a day off, we attempted to walk to the highest peak of Sweden, the Kebnekaise. It would have been a 12-14 hour hike, but after 4 hours of tough ascent in difficult terrain, the clouds came, it started raining. We had to admit it was too risky and we were not fit enough to go on. We turned back to the tent, packed up and arrived at Singhi hut soaked and exhausted. It was the hardest day in terms of hours, steps and altitude difference even though we didn't reach the peak. Of course the hard work was rewarded with breathtaking views on this day too.

item.title: Day 3 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. Part 2. After the challenging pass we reached a breathtakingly wide...
item.description: Day 3 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. Part 2. After the challenging pass we reached a breathtakingly wide and beautiful valley made by ancient glaciers. The Goubirvaggi is one of the most impressive places I've ever seen. A vast landscape of rock so remote we met only one hiker and three reindeer for the 3 first days of our hike. The reindeer escorted us for quite a while, it was magical. | 10 image(s) | Posted: Jul 30, 2023 12:59 AM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 3 of 6 in Swedish Lapland. Part 2. After the challenging pass we reached a breathtakingly wide and beautiful valley made by ancient glaciers. The Goubirvaggi is one of the most impressive places I've ever seen. A vast landscape of rock so remote we met only one hiker and three reindeer for the 3 first days of our hike. The reindeer escorted us for quite a while, it was magical.

item.title: Day 3 of 6. Part one. From Tarfala up another unmarked path over the side moraine of a glacier over...
item.description: Day 3 of 6. Part one. From Tarfala up another unmarked path over the side moraine of a glacier over lose rocks. The crux to reach the pass was either walking over the side of the Glacier or scrambling around an exposed ledge. We are not equipped or trained for glaciers, so we scramble. This pass can only be crossed with good weather conditions and we got lucky. The views just kept getting better. | 9 image(s) | Posted: Jul 30, 2023 12:30 AM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 3 of 6. Part one. From Tarfala up another unmarked path over the side moraine of a glacier over lose rocks. The crux to reach the pass was either walking over the side of the Glacier or scrambling around an exposed ledge. We are not equipped or trained for glaciers, so we scramble. This pass can only be crossed with good weather conditions and we got lucky. The views just kept getting better.

item.title: Day 2 of 6 day Lapland adventure. 6h hike through difficult terrain, no path and loads of water...
item.description: Day 2 of 6 day Lapland adventure. 6h hike through difficult terrain, no path and loads of water bodies and lose rocks. The goal was to cross an unnamed pass into the Tarfala valley. We started our hike in total fog, but an hour after we broke camp, the sun burned all the clouds away and we suddenly saw the vast mountain wilderness we had been waking into. It was an amazing feeling. We climbed the pass and were rewarded with even more amazing views of three glaciers and the Tarfala valley. Tonight we sleep in a hut and we just had sauna with glacier view. Non plus ultra. | 10 image(s) | Posted: Jul 24, 2023 11:21 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Day 2 of 6 day Lapland adventure. 6h hike through difficult terrain, no path and loads of water bodies and lose rocks. The goal was to cross an unnamed pass into the Tarfala valley. We started our hike in total fog, but an hour after we broke camp, the sun burned all the clouds away and we suddenly saw the vast mountain wilderness we had been waking into. It was an amazing feeling. We climbed the pass and were rewarded with even more amazing views of three glaciers and the Tarfala valley. Tonight we sleep in a hut and we just had sauna with glacier view. Non plus ultra.

item.title: Yesterday, day 1 of our 6 day adventure in Swedish Lapland. We arrived in Kolari by car train at...
item.description: Yesterday, day 1 of our 6 day adventure in Swedish Lapland. We arrived in Kolari by car train at 10, drove to Kiruna for last food shopping and then to Nikkaluokta. From there we took a path through a lush forest up unto a rarely visited high plateau. Despite the clouds we were treated with amazing views. The camp was wet and cold. 5 degrees in the night, but warm coffee and porridge in the morning helps. | 10 image(s) | Posted: Jul 24, 2023 11:09 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Yesterday, day 1 of our 6 day adventure in Swedish Lapland. We arrived in Kolari by car train at 10, drove to Kiruna for last food shopping and then to Nikkaluokta. From there we took a path through a lush forest up unto a rarely visited high plateau. Despite the clouds we were treated with amazing views. The camp was wet and cold. 5 degrees in the night, but warm coffee and porridge in the morning helps.

item.title: Hike number two of my week in Tenerife. The variety of landscapes on this island is baffling....
item.description: Hike number two of my week in Tenerife. The variety of landscapes on this island is baffling. Yesterday my two hostel friends and I walked through a vast forest of pines with giant needles, pinus canariensis, nowadays only found here. The winding path along steep, sometimes exposed slopes offered many awe inspiring views of Spain's highest mountan, the 3700m massive Teide volcano. | 7 image(s) | Posted: Dec 11, 2021 04:07 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Hike number two of my week in Tenerife. The variety of landscapes on this island is baffling. Yesterday my two hostel friends and I walked through a vast forest of pines with giant needles, pinus canariensis, nowadays only found here. The winding path along steep, sometimes exposed slopes offered many awe inspiring views of Spain's highest mountan, the 3700m massive Teide volcano.

item.title: The most beautiful nature you can arguably see in Switzerland. Our national park is a 170km2 area...
item.description: The most beautiful nature you can arguably see in Switzerland. Our national park is a 170km2 area of fully protected and decivilized alpine nature. There is no management at all. Previously extinct animals like bear, lynx and wolf have made their way back to Switzerland thanks to it. This year marks the first time in over 100 years that all the three of them have been sighted here in the same year. | 10 image(s) | Posted: Oct 22, 2020 10:59 AM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

The most beautiful nature you can arguably see in Switzerland. Our national park is a 170km2 area of fully protected and decivilized alpine nature. There is no management at all. Previously extinct animals like bear, lynx and wolf have made their way back to Switzerland thanks to it. This year marks the first time in over 100 years that all the three of them have been sighted here in the same year.

item.title: Dying glaciers and pioneer plants. Learned today that the Larch (L√§rche) is specialised in taking...
item.description: Dying glaciers and pioneer plants. Learned today that the Larch (L√§rche) is specialised in taking over rough territory. item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Dying glaciers and pioneer plants. Learned today that the Larch (L√§rche) is specialised in taking over rough territory. The closer to the glacier tongue you get, the smaller they are. Also, unlike firs, they color in autumn, which creates a magnificent scenery.

#autumnforests #glaciers #engadin #climatechange

item.title: Third and unexpected part of the Estonian summer hiking 2020 with @michirunagatsu. Raplamaa is a...
item.description: Third and unexpected part of the Estonian summer hiking 2020 with @michirunagatsu. Raplamaa is a mixed bag. A lot of farms and houses in decay, sometimes ugly, sometimes romantic. A lot of bone breaking asphalt walking. But also crossing of the amazing Soosalu Raba and swimming in the lake with the same name. We've now covered the whole path between the northern coast and Soomaa. Next summer we'll finish the trail. Already looking forward. @riigimets the part through the forest that you mention as difficult on the updated description is the nicest between Ardu and Soosalu. Hikers hate asphalt, please build more paths through the nature! | 10 image(s) | Posted: Aug 09, 2020 12:40 PM
item.content:encoded:
Imported from Instagram.

Third and unexpected part of the Estonian summer hiking 2020 with @michirunagatsu. Raplamaa is a mixed bag. A lot of farms and houses in decay, sometimes ugly, sometimes romantic. A lot of bone breaking asphalt walking. But also crossing of the amazing Soosalu Raba and swimming in the lake with the same name. We've now covered the whole path between the northern coast and Soomaa. Next summer we'll finish the trail. Already looking forward. @riigimets the part through the forest that you mention as difficult on the updated description is the nicest between Ardu and Soosalu. Hikers hate asphalt, please build more paths through the nature!

#oanduiklamatkatee
